content:
EXISTING STRUCTURES
─────────────────────
### Copper Cable Factory at (≈2.5, 17.5)
Consists of the production interface for copper cables:
– Cable Factory Input Chest at (2.5, 17.5)
– Factory Burner Inserter at (2.5, 16.5)
– Dedicated Burner Inserter placed at (3.5, 17.5) using direction RIGHT (serves as the factory interface)
– Assembling Machine at (1.5, 19.5) (intended to produce copper cable, currently reporting low power and missing copper-plate)

### Belt Depot at (3.5, 15.5)
Provides an isolated depot for belt distribution:
– Depot Wooden Chest at (3.5, 15.5) serving as the belt depot
– Transport Belt Segment placed adjacent at (4.5, 15.5)
– Depot Burner Inserter at (3.5, 14.5) using direction UP to transfer items from the depot

### Extraction System Connection at (–3.5, 27.5)
Facilitates the integration of extracted resources into the production network:
– Extraction System Burner Inserter at (–3.5, 27.5) with drop position at (–3.5, 28.5)

ERROR TIPS
────────────
• Transport Belt Connection Errors  
 – When connecting transport belts, do not target a Prototype.SteamEngine directly. Instead, add an inserter that inputs items into the target and use that entity for the belt connection.

• Placement Range and Inventory Issues  
 – Ensure that the player is within the allowed placement range for the target position. Move closer if the distance exceeds the maximum allowed (for example, a target distance over 10 units).  
 – Verify that the required item (e.g., a wooden chest) is present in the inventory before attempting placement.

• Variable Reference Problems  
 – Confirm that all variables (such as those holding target entity references) are properly defined before use to avoid NameErrors.
